references.paper_title: Online continual learning with natural distribution shifts: An empirical study with visual data
references.reason: This paper introduces a benchmark dataset and experimental setup for online continual learning, providing a foundation for the current work's investigation into label delay in this setting.

references.paper_title: Computationally budgeted continual learning: What does matter?
references.reason: This paper establishes a common experimental methodology for evaluating continual learning methods under computational constraints, which is directly adopted and extended in the current work.

references.paper_title: Real-time evaluation in online continual learning: A new hope
references.reason: This paper proposes a real-time online continual learning setup that directly addresses the challenge of limited computational resources in the evaluation, which is critical for the current work's focus on label delay and budget constraints.

This paper provides a comprehensive overview of self-supervised learning methods, which are evaluated in the current work to determine their effectiveness in mitigating the negative effects of label delay.

references.paper_title: A survey on semi-supervised learning for delayed partially labelled data streams
references.reason: This survey paper provides a thorough overview of semi-supervised learning techniques, many of which are investigated in the current work to handle the problem of delayed labels.
